Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
James Geoghegan Papers
Geoghegan, James
Geoghegan, James
WAG.145
0.25 Linear Feet (1 box)
1937-1966
Arrangement
This collection has not been arranged by an archivist.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date; James Geoghegan Papers; WAG 145; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Donated by James Geoghegan in 2000. The accession number associated with this gift is 2000.016.
Conditions Governing Use
Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) held by James Geoghegan were transferred to New York University in 2000 by James Geoghegan. Permission to publish or reproduce materials in this collection must be secured from Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Archives. Please contact tamiment.wagner@nyu.edu, (212) 998-2630.
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
Biographical Note
James Geoghegan was a member of the Utility Workers Union of America, Local 1-2 and served as Business Agent for the local between 1958 and 1960.
Scope and Contents
This collection contains papers related to Utility Workers of America, Local 1-2. Documents include a history of the employee relations at Con Edison, legal papers from Consolidated Edison Company of New York v. National Labor Relations Board (1937), a copy of the union's charter, and newspaper clippings.
Geoghegan, James
Unprocessed Materials1
